intro: Calamagrostis avenoides, commonly known as silver bluestem, is a tall, ornamental grass native to North America. It features narrow, silver-blue foliage that turns coppery in the fall, making it visually striking in gardens and natural landscapes. The plant produces feathery, plume-like flower spikes in late summer, adding movement and texture to the landscape. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it adaptable to various garden conditions. Calamagrostis avenoides is drought-tolerant and low-maintenance, ideal for xeriscaping and erosion control.
